definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
a hot tourist attraction/a tourist trap

sentences.english: Context is the most frequently studied theme in pragmatics.
sentences.chinese: 語境是當前語用學研究的一個熱點。

sentences.english: Thus in this period, the subject concerning two-party system and party competes becomes hot point.
sentences.chinese: 因而這一時期有關兩黨制和黨爭的話題成爲言論熱點。

sentences.english: While traditional hot-spot issues remain unresolved, new conflicts break out from time to time.
sentences.chinese: 傳統熱點依舊，新的衝突時有發生。

sentences.english: The Industrial cluster is a topic popularily concerned in the academic world either in our country or abroad in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 產業集羣是近年來國內外學術界關注的一個熱點話題。

sentences.english: Viscosity improvers are polymers with molecules that expand when they get hot.
sentences.chinese: 粘度改良劑是聚合物分子，當他們得到擴大熱點。

sentences.english: And for that matter, nearly every hotel I've stayed at has also had issues with Wi-Fi.
sentences.chinese: 並且幾乎我住過的所有酒店也都有WiFi熱點問題。

sentences.english: Sustainable developing architecture is a hot topic under discussion these years.
sentences.chinese: 可持續發展建築是近年來建築界討論的熱點。

sentences.english: Heatmaps and overlays quickly provide perspective into user behavior and habits.
sentences.chinese: 還可以根據用戶行爲與習慣生成熱點地圖與覆蓋圖。

sentences.english: Indeed the Open Platform is now one of the hottest topics in China.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，開放式平臺是中國的熱點話題之一。

sentences.english: Thermal spring tourism has become a hot topic in the field of tourism research in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年來，溫泉旅遊成爲旅遊研究的熱點問題之一。

sentences.english: The potential curricula is a new task and hotspot of the current teaching research?
sentences.chinese: 潛在課程是當今教學研究的一個新課題和熱點。

sentences.english: In recent years, aquaporins in the brain become a research hotspot.
sentences.chinese: 近年來腦部的水通道蛋白成爲研究熱點。

sentences.english: Nowadays extremophilic microbes are the hotspot in life science study.
sentences.chinese: 極端環境微生物是當今生命科學領域的研究熱點。

sentences.english: The problem whether Tarski's theory of semantic truth is that of correspondence has brought about a good burst of academic dispute.
sentences.chinese: 塔斯基語義性真理論是否爲符合論是一個爭論的熱點。

sentences.english: The biological invasion has got great attention from all over the world because of its huge harm.
sentences.chinese: 生物入侵因其巨大的危害性成爲全球關注的熱點問題。

sentences.english: Study on viable myocardium is one of the hot issues in modern cardiology.
sentences.chinese: 存活心肌的研究是目前心臟病學的研究熱點之一。

definition: slab/(geology) tectonic plate/(fig.) sector (of the stock market or of industry)/(economic) bloc
(of markets, industries, infectious diseases etc) rising/emerging/in the ascendant
Xinxing county in Yunfu 雲浮|云浮[Yun2 fu2], Guangdong/Xinxing or Hsinhsing district of Kaohsiung city 高雄市[Gao1 xiong2 shi4], south Taiwan
faucet/water tap/bicycle handle bar/chief (esp. of gang)/boss/decision maker/(market) leader (of companies)/front end of mud-flow/figurehead on prow of dragon boat 龍船|龙船
